author: jochembrouwer
content: Ok, now I am confused. If the tx reverts, then any nonce/delegation changes are not rolled back?

author: jochembrouwer
content: So if in tx account A delegates account B, but the tx itself OOGs, then B still is delegated?

author: lightclient
content: yes, there are no rollbacks except as defined in the EVM

author: jochembrouwer
content: Ok, interesting. I know that it is not mentioned in the EIP, but I actually assumed that the delegations were rolled back if the tx went OOG

author: gumb00
content: yeah definitely worth to mention in EIP

author: gumb00
content: (I found some way to make this work)

author: jochembrouwer
content: I have another edge case. What if I delegate account A to account B, where account B SELFDESTRUCTs. In the same tx as delegation, I call account A, so this will call selfdestruct on itself. Since this technically creates a ""contract"" in the same tx, should it be deleted?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Wait nvm we dont want to delete EOAs from state. But I think this should also be clarified in the eip
